intro: Hermbstaedtia odorata var. aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-flowered hermbstaedtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, with a distinctive scent that attracts pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
